DOC.brief_summary: This study examine effect carbohydrate type ( high- low-Glycemic Index ( GI ) ) amount ( high- low-Glycemic Load ( GL ) ) blood glucose level , blood pressure arterial stiffness healthy individual . It also determine whether subjective rating test meal palatability hunger relate change blood glucose . The investigator hypothesize : ( 1 ) High-GI meal , regardless GL , increase arterial stiffness ; low-GI meal , regardless GL , neutral lower effect arterial stiffness ( augmentation index ) . ( 2 ) High-GI meal , regardless GL , elevate effect central peripheral blood pressure . ( 3 ) The incremental area curve blood glucose show significant difference high-GI , high-GL low-GI , low-GL meal 30 90 min .
DOC.brief_title: Acute Vascular Response To Meals Varying In Glycemic Index And Glycemic Load
DOC.criteria: healthy age 18 75 year BMI 18 25 kg/m2 brachial systolic blood pressure < 140 mmHg brachial diastolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg primary hypertension diabetes allergy sensitivity food use study gastrointestinal disorder chronic kidney disease liver disease hepatitis estrogensensitive cancer heavy alcohol use sleep apnea bleed disorder plan surgery ( within time frame study ) angina Congestive Heart Failure coronary revascularization peripheral vascular disease and/or coronary/cerebrovascular event within previous 6 month positive HIV diagnosis prescription antidepressant , antihypertensive , anticoagulant medication , diuretic , sympathomimetics , herbal therapy , vitamin K supplementation , medication affect NO synthesis chronic use prescription NSAIDs woman childbearing potential must pregnant breastfeeding
